This should be closed, since this is no longer the case in the master branch of CipheyCore. It is however still in , and is as far as I can see due to the following snippet <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Ciphey/CipheyCore/blob/d7c7725bba90971e9757be1f039403c9e935ec71/include/ciphey/swig.hpp#L190-L195>https://github.com/Ciphey/CipheyCore/blob/d7c7725bba90971e9757be1f039403c9e935ec71/include/ciphey/swig.hpp#L190-L195</denchmark-link>

Also, a quick way to ensure that this code path is the one leading to this issue is to create a small py file anywhere in the Ciphey project with the following (both plaintext and candidate key can be chosen arbitrarily): <denchmark-code>import cipheycore plaintext = "AA".encode() candidate_key = 0x00 cipheycore.xor_single_decrypt(plaintext, candidate_key) </denchmark-code>
By running this file you can observe the random hex output (make sure to be on tag v.0.3.1)
